reviews.review: reminds me of the good old days

Amazing game! Still holds up incredibly after more than a decade! Lots of fun especially when playing as the infected with friends. Definitely worth the price and if it's on sale, it's an absolute must buy! Don't miss out on this gem.

Once in a while, a game comes along that gives its genre a violent shake and a slap. Left 4 Dead is one such game.

At its heart, L4D is a multiplayer game of humans versus infected. There is a clear distinction here - they are not undead, rather 'infected' - a term that gave Left 4 Dead 2 trouble with the Australian Classification Board some time ago. The vast majority of the population is infected. The opening sequence gives a surprisingly good overview of each map, with the point of each being to reach an escape transport and evacuate the area.

While there is a single player option, it lacks the unpredictability and excitement of multiplayer, so is perhaps best used to hone one's skills before attempting online play, and potential embarrassment.

In each scenario, there are four survivors. They are always the same - Bill, Louis, Francis and Zoey. You choose which one you want to play and (if you are playing single player) the computer takes control of the other three, and does a reasonable job. For multiplayer, depending on whether you play versus or campaign or survivor mode, you may have up to 3 to 7 extra players in the one game. In versus mode the other team plays as the infected, controlling random special infected, and cycling through each different type whenever they die.

Hectic, frantic, panic, adrenaline. All good words to describe the action barely contained in each scenario. You will come to learn very quickly that being alone is hazardous to everyone's else, not just your own. The general infected populace is always faster than you. Nowhere are you safe from them. They scramble up walls and fences. They scamper under obstructions. They zigzag as they run at you. Mobs can be terrifying if you don't know where they are coming from, or catch you unprepared.
